intro: Coccocypselum macropodum, commonly known as the large-footed coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are simple and ovate, often with a hairy texture. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid environments.
